casebody.data:
STATE EX REL. UTILITIES COMMISSION
v.
ATTORNEY GENERAL 271A18-1 Supreme Court of North Carolina. March 18, 2019 Margaret A. Force, Assistant Attorney General, Matthew W. Sawchak, Solicitor General, Jennifer T. Harrod, Attorney at Law, Raleigh, Teresa L. Townsend, Assistant Attorney General, James W. Doggett, Deputy Solicitor General, for Stein, Josh (Attorney General) Kiran H. Mehta, Attorney at Law, Charlotte, Christopher G. Browning, Jr., Attorney at Law, Raleigh, Molly Leigh McIntosh, Attorney at Law, for Duke Energy Progress, LLC Matthew D. Quinn, Attorney at Law, Raleigh, for Sierra Club David T. Drooz, Staff Attorney, Chapel Hill, Lucy E. Edmondson, Staff Attorney, Raleigh, for Public Staff-N.C. Utilities Commission James P. West, Attorney at Law, for Fayetteville Public Works Commission Kyle J. Smith, Attorney at Law, for Department of Defense/Federal Executive Agencies

Amended

The following order has been entered on the Motion for Extension of Time to File Appellant Briefs filed on the 14th of March 2019 by Attorney General:

"Motion Allowed by order of the Court in conference, this the 18th of March 2019."

Attorney General shall have up to and including the 26th day of April 2019 to file and serve his/her brief with this Court.
